title: Oscar Pistorius to be released from prison on Tuesday, faces house arrest
text:
Oscar Pistorius to be released from prison on Tuesday, faces house arrest Resize Text By Matt Bonesteel October 15 at 9:54 AM Follow @MattBonesteel (AP Photo/Themba Hadebe, File) 
South Africa’s department of correctional services announced Thursday that Oscar Pistorius, the Paralympian track athlete who was found guilty of manslaughter in the 2013 shooting death of girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, will be released from prison on Tuesday and placed under house arrest. 
Pistorius received a five-year prison sentence after he was found guilty in September 2014 of culpable homicide, the South African equivalent of manslaughter. He was scheduled to be placed under house arrest in August, but South African justice minister Michael Masutha ruled that Pistorius remain in prison until this month. 
According to a Guardian story published in August , Pistorius’s house arrest won’t exactly be a taxing punishment: 
He is expected to stay at his uncle Arnold’s three-storey mansion in a wealthy suburb of Pretoria. He is likely to be allowed to leave the house to work, carry out community service or to attend important family events, and officials say he will not have to wear an electronic monitoring device. 
Prosecutors in the case have appealed the judge’s ruling in the case, saying she incorrectly applied South African law in making her decision and that Pistorius deliberately killed Steenkamp. The first hearing about their appeal will take place Nov. 3, with prosecutors asking for a murder conviction and a stronger sentence.
